 # Catcher Game

## Set the Scene!
* Grab a ``||Scene:set background image to [ ]||`` block from ``||Scene:Scene||`` and drag it inside the ``||Loops:on start||`` block.
* To choose your background, click the blank and head to the **Gallery** tab at the top. There are plenty of pictures to choose from!
* From ``||Info:Info||``, drag a ``||Info:set score to 0||`` block, and connect it underneath ``||Scene:set background image to [ ]||``

## Create Your Player
* From ``||Sprites:Sprites||``, drag the ``||Sprites:set mySprite to sprite [ ] of kind [ ]||`` underneath the previous block.
* Set the second blank to any character you'd like. When you click the blank, there's a bunch to choose from in the **Gallery** tab!
* Set the third blank to **Player**

## Control Your Player
* From ``||Sprites:Sprites||``, drag the ``||Sprites:set mySprite position to x [ ] y [ ]||`` underneath the previous block.
* Set the first blank to **mySprite**
* Set x to 80 and y to 100. This should make your character start at the bottom center of your game screen. 
You can change the numbers if you'd like.
* From ``||Controller:Controller||`` drag the ``||move [ ] with buttons||`` block and connect it underneath the previous blocks.
* Set the blank to **mySprite**. This lets the controller know you want to control your character!

## Create the Enemy!
* From ``||Loops:Loops||`` grab the ``||forever||`` block and drop it in any blank spot on your workspace. 
* From ``||Sprites:Sprites||``, drag the ``||Sprites:set [ ] to sprite [ ] of kind [ ]||`` underneath the previous block. *This should look familiar!*
* Set the first blank to **mySprite2**
* Set the second blank to any enemy you'd like. When you click the blank, there's a bunch to choose from in the **Gallery** tab!
* Set the third blank to **Enemy**

```blocks
forever(function () {
    mySprite2 = sprites.create(img`
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . c c c c . . . . 
        . . . . . . c c d d d d c . . . 
        . . . . . c c c c c c d c . . . 
        . . . . c c 4 4 4 4 d c c . . . 
        . . . c 4 d 4 4 4 4 4 1 c . c c 
        . . c 4 4 4 1 4 4 4 4 d 1 c 4 c 
        . c 4 4 4 4 1 4 4 4 4 4 1 c 4 c 
        f 4 4 4 4 4 1 4 4 4 4 4 1 4 4 f 
        f 4 4 4 f 4 1 c c 4 4 4 1 f 4 f 
        f 4 4 4 4 4 1 4 4 f 4 4 d f 4 f 
        . f 4 4 4 4 1 c 4 f 4 d f f f f 
        . . f f 4 d 4 4 f f 4 c f c . . 
        . . . . f f 4 4 4 4 c d b c . . 
        . . . . . . f f f f d d d c . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . c c c . . . 
        `, SpriteKind.Enemy)
})
```


## Control the Enemy!
We'd like our enemy to appear randomly on our screen, so...
* From ``||Sprites:Sprites||``, drag the ``||Sprites:set [ ] position to x [ ] y [ ]||`` underneath the previous block. 
* Set the first blank to **mySprite2**!
```blocks
let mySprite2: Sprite = null
forever(function () {
    mySprite2 = sprites.create(img`
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . c c c c . . . . 
        . . . . . . c c d d d d c . . . 
        . . . . . c c c c c c d c . . . 
        . . . . c c 4 4 4 4 d c c . . . 
        . . . c 4 d 4 4 4 4 4 1 c . c c 
        . . c 4 4 4 1 4 4 4 4 d 1 c 4 c 
        . c 4 4 4 4 1 4 4 4 4 4 1 c 4 c 
        f 4 4 4 4 4 1 4 4 4 4 4 1 4 4 f 
        f 4 4 4 f 4 1 c c 4 4 4 1 f 4 f 
        f 4 4 4 4 4 1 4 4 f 4 4 d f 4 f 
        . f 4 4 4 4 1 c 4 f 4 d f f f f 
        . . f f 4 d 4 4 f f 4 c f c . . 
        . . . . f f 4 4 4 4 c d b c . . 
        . . . . . . f f f f d d d c . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . c c c . . . 
        `, SpriteKind.Enemy)
    mySprite2.setPosition(,)
})
```

## Control the Enemy! (cont.)
* Since our screen is roughly 160 units(*pixels*) wide and 110 units tall, we'll use ``||Math:pick random [ ] to [ ]||`` to 
randomly generate positions. **You'll need 2 of these blocks!**
* Set the first number to 0, and the second number to 160 and 110 on the blocks.
* Now drag the ``||Math:pick random 0 to 160||`` block inside the x blank of ``||Sprites:set [ ] position to x [ ] y [ ]||`` 
and ``||Math:pick random 0 to 110||`` to the y blank.
```blocks
let mySprite2: Sprite = null
forever(function () {
    mySprite2 = sprites.create(img`
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . c c c c . . . . 
        . . . . . . c c d d d d c . . . 
        . . . . . c c c c c c d c . . . 
        . . . . c c 4 4 4 4 d c c . . . 
        . . . c 4 d 4 4 4 4 4 1 c . c c 
        . . c 4 4 4 1 4 4 4 4 d 1 c 4 c 
        . c 4 4 4 4 1 4 4 4 4 4 1 c 4 c 
        f 4 4 4 4 4 1 4 4 4 4 4 1 4 4 f 
        f 4 4 4 f 4 1 c c 4 4 4 1 f 4 f 
        f 4 4 4 4 4 1 4 4 f 4 4 d f 4 f 
        . f 4 4 4 4 1 c 4 f 4 d f f f f 
        . . f f 4 d 4 4 f f 4 c f c . . 
        . . . . f f 4 4 4 4 c d b c . . 
        . . . . . . f f f f d d d c . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . c c c . . . 
        `, SpriteKind.Enemy)
    mySprite2.setPosition(randint(0, 160), randint(0, 100))
})
```

## Control the Enemy! (cont.)
* Since we don't want the enemy to spawn too quickly, grab a ```||Loops:pause [ ]||`` block from `||Loops:Loops||`` and connect it underneath everything else.
* Set the number to **1 second**. Now, your enemy will appear once every second!

```blocks
let mySprite2: Sprite = null
forever(function () {
    mySprite2 = sprites.create(img`
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . c c c c . . . . 
        . . . . . . c c d d d d c . . . 
        . . . . . c c c c c c d c . . . 
        . . . . c c 4 4 4 4 d c c . . . 
        . . . c 4 d 4 4 4 4 4 1 c . c c 
        . . c 4 4 4 1 4 4 4 4 d 1 c 4 c 
        . c 4 4 4 4 1 4 4 4 4 4 1 c 4 c 
        f 4 4 4 4 4 1 4 4 4 4 4 1 4 4 f 
        f 4 4 4 f 4 1 c c 4 4 4 1 f 4 f 
        f 4 4 4 4 4 1 4 4 f 4 4 d f 4 f 
        . f 4 4 4 4 1 c 4 f 4 d f f f f 
        . . f f 4 d 4 4 f f 4 c f c . . 
        . . . . f f 4 4 4 4 c d b c . . 
        . . . . . . f f f f d d d c . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . c c c . . . 
        `, SpriteKind.Enemy)
    mySprite2.setPosition(randint(0, 160), randint(0, 100))
    pause(500)
})
```


## Almost There!
Now, we'll keep track of the score!
* From ``||Sprites:Sprites||``, drag the ``||Sprites:on sprite of kind [ ] overlaps with otherSprite of kind [ ]||`` block into your workspace. *This will let the computer know 
when your player touches the enemy!*
* Set the first kind to **Player** and the second kind to **Enemy**.
* From ``||Sprites:Sprites||``, drag the ``||Sprites:destroy [ ]||`` underneath your other blocks.
* Set the blank to **otherSprite**. 
* From ``||Info:Info||``, drag the ``||Info:change score by 1||`` block underneath your previous block.

```blocks
sprites.onOverlap(SpriteKind.Player, SpriteKind.Food, function (sprite, otherSprite) {
    otherSprite.destroy()
    info.changeScoreBy(1)
})
```

let mySprite = sprites.create(img`

    ..........ff............

> Open this page at [https://anguslam228.github.io/catcher-tutorial/](https://anguslam228.github.io/catcher-tutorial/)

## Use as Extension

This repository can be added as an **extension** in MakeCode.

* open [https://arcade.makecode.com/](https://arcade.makecode.com/)
* click on **New Project**
* click on **Extensions** under the gearwheel menu
* search for **https://github.com/anguslam228/catcher-tutorial** and import

## Edit this project ![Build status badge](https://github.com/anguslam228/catcher-tutorial/workflows/MakeCode/badge.svg)

To edit this repository in MakeCode.

* open [https://arcade.makecode.com/](https://arcade.makecode.com/)
* click on **Import** then click on **Import URL**
* paste **https://github.com/anguslam228/catcher-tutorial** and click import
